Reviews.Title: So Excellent In So Many Ways
Reviews.Author: Sunglass Evaluator
Reviews.Content: If you want the bottom line right up front, it would be hard for me to believe a compact point-and-shoot camera could get any better than this Samsung MV900F, unless you spend way more money, and even then I'm not sure how it would get any better in any practical way. Maybe if you need an attachable speed-flash, or need even more than 5x optical zoom, and maybe, as I used to think, that I needed raw or uncompressed files ( the photos I got from this camera in super-fine quality mode (JPG) are so excellent and fully editable, that I now don't think I need raw or uncompressed files anymore).Now for the more detailed: I've had many digital cameras, even more expensive ones from Nikon, Cannon, and Minolta, and a number of small Cannon 'Elfs'. This time, as usual, I first looked at all the Nikon and Canon models. but was having difficulty finding a highly-rated camera with a FAST lens and at least 3X optical zoom in a compact model without spending between $600 and $1000. Then I saw a review with the MV900F rated as 2nd best out of about 20 new point and shoot cameras. I was skeptical, but not only does this camera have the very fast 5X optical zoom lens, it also has what they call a Back-lit Sensor, which they say significantly helps in low-light, so it's no wonder reviews say it's really easy to take great looking photos, even in low light without flash. I have confirmed that every photo I've taken, without a tripod, with and without flash, without even trying all that hard, has been as perfect as I can see on a 1600 x 1200 computer screen. I just use the Auto Smart mode, the Super-Fine quality setting, and the 1920 x 1080 resolution, because seriousy why would anyone need more resolution than that? One complaint is that you have to first switch to Program Mode in order to see the setting for image Quality. I tried both Program Mode and Auto Smart mode for shooting, and both seem perfectly automatic in every way I noticed.In my opinion, using the bright, high-resolution, 3.3" LCD Wide-Screen on this camera is not only effectively a single-lens (SLR), because what you see on the screen is through the same lens as the camera, but also you see in real time exactly how focused and light-balanced the photo you are going to take will be. I have not used it in direct sunlight with the sun behind me yet, but they say it is bright enough for that. I don't expect that to be a problem, but if it is I can go back to using my Minolta with a high-resolution peep-hole for those type of shots if necessary.Rotating Screen! Not only for use looking at yourself, but when you rotate it out 45 degrees and flip the camera over above your head, like when you need to take pictures or video when standing behind a crowd, this camera automatically flips the image right-side-up for you.So, lets see, with a super-fast 5x lens, perfect fast autofocus, minimal size and weight, 3.3 inch high-definition rotating wide-screen, and HD video just as starters, this camera already had me convinced at only $248, but then there's more...Touch screen! This might be a negative in the sense that you don't get as many knobs and buttons to do things directly, but what they say in the reviews is true; after a little getting used to, you can get to what you need fast on the tough screen, so that's not a problem, and there just isn't any other way to get that large of a screen on that small of a camera (you need to get rid of all the extra knobs and buttons or make the camera bigger, and I think smaller is better).Built-in WiFI! I haven't used that yet, but if you want it it's in there.HDMI output! You do need to buy a cable with the smaller connector on the camera end.Loads of built-in modes, options, editing abilities, etc, etc.Like I wrote at the beginning, it would be hard for me to believe a compact point-and-shoot camera could get any better without spending way more money.

Reviews.Title: Just got it but....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera on Nov. 23, 2012 from Samsung fulfilled by Beach Camera. I received it yesterday, plugged it in. Then woke up this morning to not being able to turn it on. I take out the battery and put it back in and then the red indicator light turns on again and I leave it for a bit. Then the red light indicator turns off which is supposed to mean that it is fully charged and I go to try to turn it on. Green light comes on and flashes and then nothing happens.Contacted Samsung about this. They just referred me to a Service Request.... THIS CAMERA IS NEW OUT OF THE BOX. I've never had any trouble with Samsung before. I will continue to try to see what is wrong with this camera and not charging and update this review. But for now..... this camera is not charging right. Believe me I've checked the outlet, cord, and battery and all are in the correct position and working...Also to note, this camera uses MICRO SD cards.... Not bad, makes it more compact... but I still have yet to test out the functionality because I STILL have yet to turn on the camera. :(Update 11-30-12Figured out that my sandisk class 10 micro SD card was to blame. (Why it wasn't turning on) Also that I needed to reformat it because it had incompatitible content on it after I used it on my phone. Will try that and see how it works... Have to test the rest of the functionality soon. Am going to give it a try over the weekend :) Just took some pics of my dogs and they turned out great tho!! :) Excited! Will update soon :)Update 12-13-12I LOVE this camera. I took it to the oldest cathedral in Chicago and snapped some awesome photos of the architecture. Tried out the panorama feature, video, and low light. I also tried the beauty palette.... Its like instant photoshop and so much fun to play with! It makes some faces look.... well photoshopped. I managed to get another sandisk micro SD 32gb class 10 and it works great! :) I used the flip out portion to get good self shots and shots at awkward angles. Also took some great professional looking shots of my dogs :PThe only thing with this camera is that it is has a slow shutter speed and the photos in dim lighting don't turn out so well... But as far as a sunny day outdoors or well light indoors, it takes great photos. Ultimately it is just what I wanted. Now i want to find out how to get that Hat feature....I would recommend to get this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that had a flip screen (to record videos for YouTube) and something that was small.  This fits the bill!  The picture is clear and it uploads nicely.  The screen does shut off when doing video (after a certain amount of time) and you have to touch it to see again (I'm assuming it's a feature to save on the battery) and I don't like that because I like to see what I'm videoing while I'm doing it.  The battery also drains fast so I find that a bit annoying.  Other than that...I really like the camera and it has many of the qualities I was looking for.  I really like that it has the same plug as my Droid phone so I can use my phone charger to charge the camera too (nice for in the car)!

Reviews.Title: Perfect snapshot camera
Reviews.Author: gordonius
Reviews.Content: The MV900F was bought for my wife to use. She didn't want an overly complex camera and she has poor eyesight that requires her to wear glasses. The MV900F is perfect because of the large display screen including the swivel feature that aids with reflections in addition to the large icons and "finger select" screen. The default setting for automatically sensing the environment produces great snapshot photos and the menus are intuitive enough so that anyone who has previously used a modern touch screen phone, will feel comfortable with the options and selections in a short time after beginning to use the camera. the camera looks stunning in white and she is delighted that I chose that color. She is now carrying the camera with her in her bag all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good but not a fan of the touch screen
Reviews.Author: rebeccam
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a cruise to Alaska knowing it was thin and compact, therefore easy to carry around in my purse. I especially wanted a 180-flip out screen so it would be easy to take pictures of myself and friends. I received it today and was very pleased. The pictures are great and the shutter speed is satisfactory. My only complaint is that the touch screen is unresponsive sometimes, and lags a lot when using features such as fun pictures frames and camera filters. Also the interface is not user friendly when scrolling through pictures. You have to slide your finger awkwardly and takes a little while to really master. Overall, I do not regret buying the camera and want to applaud Samsung for contributing another great piece of technology!

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot so far
Reviews.Author: Stefan
Reviews.Content: I got this to complement my Canon 7D for moments when you don't feel like carrying around a big camera. Lots of settings and predefined photo-editing features right in the camera. the WiFi feature is difficult to set and extremely slow which makes it a feature you stay away from. Don't buy this one for the wifi function and you will be very happy with the results. Memory card is NOT included.

Reviews.Title: SHOCKINGLY GREAT
Reviews.Author: Diverse Interests
Reviews.Content: When I took this camera out of the box I was shocked by its tiny size; smaller and lighter than my HTC Windows Phone X.  I, frankly, was concerned that I had bought a piece of junk.  After all, I bought it for less than I got for my three year old Canon G10 on Ebay.I traded in the G10, which is the top of the line Canon point and shoot, because I was tired of having to download pictures to my computer and then send them by email or upload them to SkyDrive.  Then, there was always the issue of backup.  The camera also took terrible portraits no matter what I tried and had a firmware problem with purple hues and white balance outside.  I like to take macro shots of my flowers and it was tricky to keep it from whiting out.  So, I had been taking most of my pictures on the HTC phone which is actually pretty good, but being a phone without a zooming lens, it fisheyes with close up shots.I wrote all that because this tiny MV900F solved all of those problems and more in my first 24 hours.  We took a birthday self-portrait with the display facing us.  It came out crisp enough to show all of my wrinkles.  And then, I immediately emailed it to my daughter halfway around the world.  My flower shots were perfect on the auto setting.  As crisp and detailed an any I have ever taken.  On the auto setting, the indicator changed from night shot to macro as I walked from my house to daylight.  It selected the focal point but always seemed to get it right (flowers not leaves).Pairing the camera with my wifi was simple as was the setup with SkyDrive and email.  Indeed, I selected this one because it has a specific SkyDrive function.  I sent one to myself by email.  Looks great.  I think that it even automatically reduces the file size for transfer but the resolution is still great on the receiving end.  And, there are many features I have yet to explore.The only downside I have seen is some slowness and jerkiness in the zoom response and slow transfer by wifi.  Indeed, I ended up putting the camera next to the router to send 7 pictures to SkyDrive.  But, hey, for the money?And, of course, these are not professional level photos.  But I just need to capture, share and remember my world accurately and in focus.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Julianna Chow
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera so i could take it to cancun with my friends. love how i can use the same charger for this camera and my phone. takes a bit of time to get the hang of the gesture shots. in the beginning i wasn't satisfied with the quality of the photos but then it was just because i had the settings to small resolution pictures.

Reviews.Title: Does it all
Reviews.Author: Elle77
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I have had several point and shoot cameras over time, and let me just say this one does it all. I like that I can email, Facebook,ex.... From the camera itself (using wifi) or just send the pics, video ex.... from the camera straight to my computer for storage (also using the wifi) So many possibilities! It has all kinds of fun special effect stuff too, to kinda play with. I love the large touch screen, and the self portraits capabilities. It's also super light weight, and not to much bulk. The self portrait hand gesture thing is neat to. Love the red color of the camera, and the pic quality is nice,Good job Samsung!

Reviews.Title: the it camera to have
Reviews.Author: mzluv
Reviews.Content: I love this camera the pictures are clear and very easy to take self photos. ... luv the WiFi connection easy to transfer pictures. ...

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: this is the greatest camera. when I bought it I was sure cause not all the feature are listed. it takes great phoots easyTouch sreen, flips up to see what you are taking the photo of. rotates like a smart phone post directly to facebbok, twitter and other social networks was really easy also has a vertiual keypad

Reviews.Title: great camera but........!
Reviews.Author: SEAN
Reviews.Content: ok so i bought this camera for my mom for xmas as a replacement of her old and outdated fujifilm camera which must have been 5 years old. Let me start off by saying that this is a great camera! Picture quality is amazing. All of the different modes for different pictures are fun. My favorite has to be the panoramic mode where you can take a pics while moving camera and get a view of a whole room or maybe like a whole party or skyline. So there are many pros to this camera its quality, size, flip screen, touch screen, and also takes decent videos for a point and shoot camera. There is one thing that is annoying about this camera. I had assumed that i would have no problem with the wifi and connecting to my moms smart phone. Well I thought wrong. On my android phone i had no problems uploading pics from the camera but on my moms brand new top of the line blackberry there is no app for samsung! This may be due to the fact that it is a work phone so i had a backup with the ipad i also got her as a gift for xmas. The i pad has the app, i downloaded and installed but again some technical glitch prevents me or her really from uploading to the ipad. So i thought i was being smart buying a smart camera but the camera is not smart enough! not a big deal to my mom but it is a big deal for me, so basically great camera, great quality but the camera isnt smart enough for all types of smart phones or a brand new i pad 3? Reaslly samsung. MY next move is to call customer service and see if they can help with the connection to the ipad but if they cant resolve the connection issue I should have done a little more research! BUT IN NO WAY AM I SAYING THIS IS A BAD BUY GREAT VALUE GREAT QUALITY! so samsung you got 4 stars from me! All that matters is that my mom loves it but me being a tech geek would have liked for her to be able to upload and share on the spot! hope this is helpful to anyone planning on buying this camera!

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Walter Wu
Reviews.Content: it cannot take pictures in broad daylight in smart mode; it chooses shutter speeds such as 1/2000 leading to very dark pictures. When I contacted Samsung chat support, I was told "xxxxxxx: No, it will take clear pictures but while taking pictures in brightness we have to adjust the settings manually." Let's see if there's a better resolution in store after the agent checks in with HQ.Update: agent asked me to submit a service request. However, as of 5/25/2013, this camera model is not available for a service request on samsung's own service website. The saga continues!

Reviews.Title: Samsung camera
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good, many features very good quality of pictures, but the battery doesnt last enough.the size and weigth are also great.

Reviews.Title: Great Vacation/on the go Camera
Reviews.Author: Secret Asian Man
Reviews.Content: Pros - picture quality, size, and priceCons - advance features like wi fi, social media uploading, and low light pictures eats your batteryI bought this camera right before a 2 week trip to Italy.  I played with it 2 days, did buy 2 extra batteries and a travel charger and off we went.  Took 3,500 pictures with this little guy.  2500 were keepers and the rest were not the cameras fault. Used it at night, Used it during the day, in the rain, etc....it was a little trouper.  I kept strap and camera locked in my hand at all times, something I could not do with a larger camera and feel safe. After returning back home, all my friends and family wanted to know what camera I used because of the pictures I shared.  5 other friends and family now have this camera. For the price point you can't beat it.I gave it 4 stars because of the battery life and the zoom control, takes some getting used too.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: It was ok pocket camera. I only have been using it one time with it. The picture came out well. The feature of the flip cScreen is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: You may want to reconsider..
Reviews.Author: Ezmeralda Acosta
Reviews.Content: The camera worked for the first day then quit working. I had to call samsung tech support who could not solve the issue. I then had to pay for shipping cost and wait 2 weeks while it was repaired. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: navywill
Reviews.Content: Love the camera.  Needed something that could take pictures indoors in low light situations and quality outdoor pictures as well.  I've been very pleased thus far I just wish it had capabilities to upload to different cloud services

Reviews.Title: Fantastic small mult-purpose camera.
Reviews.Author: hillcountry "jdimaging"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little camera!  Much easier to carry than my big SLR, and it is loaded with features.  I have not used many of the features like direct posting to Facebook, but using my Samsung Galaxy S3 to remote control this little camera is really nice.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Ramsey Moorman
Reviews.Content: Takes great shots and very portable.  I love the flip screen as well.  Wifi feature works great and is very convenient!

Reviews.Title: Samsung MV900F
Reviews.Author: FER
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera at a reasonable price.Video is great.Reverse screen is very convenientStill images are also great quality

Reviews.Title: Epic
Reviews.Author: Gegechi
Reviews.Content: The LCD screen which flapped upto 180 degree　is useful to take a selfportrait. F value is so nice that I could take photos in dark circumstance. This camera has good wifi system, so I can transfer my photos to my i-pad and PC without codes.

Reviews.Title: FACEBOOK, AND TWITTER ON THE GO IS NICE
Reviews.Author: Ronald Walbrook
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this camera is that you can snap a pic and log onto the internet right on the camera to post. This camera is exactly what i needed when i went out of the country, it doesn't get any better than this

Reviews.Title: Loving it!  Great in low lighting conditions.
Reviews.Author: David Cummings "indian1301"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a simple point and shoot camera and picked this one for it's simplicity and comments that it worked well in low lighting situations.  I have been happy on both counts.  Actually I'm amazed at it's ability in low lighting conditions as it far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Love Wi Fi but battery doesn't stay charged long
Reviews.Author: Paula
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it is because I take many pictures at once & then email w/wifi right away but the battery does not seem to last very long. I do love the concept and the pics are great -- just not sure what's up with the battery. I start with a full charge & w/in 1.75 hours of pic taking & email, it's kaputz.  Item was shipped very promptly.

Reviews.Title: The envy
Reviews.Author: Maggie A Murphy
Reviews.Content: This camera is the envy of everyone who sees it.  It takes great pictures, is fast and the best camera I've ever owned.  I needed something easy to work with, that took really fast shots in any kind of light and it's exactly what I wanted!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jovian Lam
Reviews.Content: Camera is relatively cheap and it has a lot of functions. The flip function is really cool. Shipping was fast. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: MrsMartens
Reviews.Content: The delay between shots is the longest of any camera I have owned.  Video uploads have to be less than 30 sec, this was huge to me because one of the main reasons I purchased the camera was to be able to upload videos online.  The touch screen is temperamental, sometimes it moves screens quickly other times it's like I am not even touching it.  Don't waste your money on this camera when there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: lynn
Reviews.Content: I love the design and layout of the camera! It's my first digital camera and I recommend it to anybody!

Reviews.Title: FUN CAMERA~!
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Bruno "Dawg3"
Reviews.Content: Great design. Fun for self portraits. Great screen. Lots of extras. Picture quality is great. Very happy with this Camera~!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera......
Reviews.Author: J. Francis
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  The pictures are crystal clear and it offers numerous modes.  I love the timer feature.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: loves2read
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, easy to use. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a great compact camera. If you get this don't forget to buy a memory card. Our last camera came with one but this did not. Can't even use the camera without it.

Reviews.Title: Mac compatibility? Help?
Reviews.Author: Trisha M. Olsson "Trisha"
Reviews.Content: I am leaving a 3 star rating because although the camera seems great so far (ease of use, pictures, videos, all what I would expect in this price range), it doesn't seem very Mac friendly? I've looked through forums, and also the Samsung website for help, but haven't gotten the answer I need.  When I connect my camera to my Macbook Air through the USB, the software should load, but it gives the message "the disk you inserted is not readable by this computer." I can still access the files through the drive, but if it doesn't load the software, it diminishes the ability to wirelessly sync files to my computer (part of the appeal of buying the product).  I felt that I pretty thoroughly read Amazon reviews before purchasing this product, but don't remember seeing this concern. Is anyone else having similar issues and found a work-around?

Reviews.Title: Pleased with the Purchase
Reviews.Author: Eileen in CA "EW"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am happy with my purchase of this camera. I had a Panasonic DC before and loved it, but it was missing two key features that I missed, and I found them in this Samsung camera: the flip-screen and capability to zoom while video recording. This is the only camera I found in the price range ($100-250) that has a compact size, flip screen and zoom while recording. It also has panorama feature which I didn't have on my old camera.The flip-screen is really handy when I don't want to be too obvious when recording a video. I don't have to hold the camera up by my face, I can put it down and position the screen so I can make sure whatever I'm recording, is positioned properly.At the beginning I was having problems with corrupted videos that would not play back, but I discovered that was because out of habit, I kept trying to stop the videos by pressing on the shutter button on top of the camera (the button used to take photos). Then, thinking I had stopped the video, I would turn off the camera - since the camera was turned off before the video was properly stopped, it would render the video unplayable. We can only start and stop videos by touching the touch-screen. It takes some practice not to automatically use the button on top.Sometimes I have to press the features on the touch screen two or three times before they come up, that's my only gripe with this camera. I miss actual buttons that have predictable results the first time. Overall though, the camera takes great: takes clear pictures and excellent videos!

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: spark1230
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable camera to take great looking photos when I go to Paris next year, because I wanted better quality photos compared to what my galaxy s2 phone camera can take. I decided to order this one, because I liked the multiview feature for easy self portraits and the wifi feature for easier uploading. So far, I am very happy with this camera; both features work great for me. The flippable multi-view feature makes it so easy to take selfies, and the wifi feature saves me a lot of time as it directly uploads the photos I want to Facebook. The fun editing and filter features also saves me a lot of time, because I can just edit the pictures on the camera and directly upload it online. I definitely recommend this camera for those who are looking for a camera that takes great quality features but isn't as expensive and complicated as DSLR's.

Reviews.Title: Much better then MV800
Reviews.Author: Jean-Philippe
Reviews.Content: I used to make pictures at my events with a Samsung MV800 which happened to have only one issue : poor performance in low light. When I lost it, I decided to purchase the MV900 which solves this problem, whic takes pictures relatively fast, equipped with a fast SD card. The new gesture selfportrait is funny yet I always use the button on the back to make it quicker. The color white eventually fits my Samsung Galaxy, seems like I will purchase more products of this rising brand-superstar !The overall quality of the image is great. One my favorite gadget is the live panorama mode allowing a 180 view, which brings fantastic results in natural bright light. The zooming shot is my favorite effect in Photo Filter, it works well and allows fun creativity when making pictures of people, bringing a sense of movement and action.Finally, the introduction of the wi-fi capability is interesting, I guess for non-computer savy people.A five star fancy affordable point-and-shoot !

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife. She absolutely loves the flip screen to be able to take self portraits.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves this.
Reviews.Author: Marshaleigh
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 24 year old daughter who loves a good camera for sharing with friends, using it on social sites and having lots of fun bells and whistles - she's very happy with it. Nice quality photos and has Wifi.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Koontz
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my 15 year old daughter and she is able to use it easily and the flip up screen is great for self portrates.  Wi-fi was set up by her and was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: hill
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera with all of today's newest technologies.  The wi-fi connection makes sharing your pictures  easier than ever.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: Samwise
Reviews.Content: I purchased the MV900F mainly for the purpose of self-portrait shot.  While cell phone cameras have improved on the latest iPhone and Android phones, the quality you get from a mid-tier camera is still much better.  This MV900F is very light weight, starts up fast, and has a simple touch-screen menu and minimal buttons.  The picture quality is above average, though not top-notch.  The touch-screen itself is above average, but fingerprint prone and sometimes not sensitive enough.  Didn't try the WIFI option as it's so much faster to transfer photos via plugging the memory card into a laptop.Overall if you use the self portrait (yourself or with a small group of friends), it's a fantastic camera.  The extra fluff of wifi and gesture shots, etc didn't appeal to me.  The multiview itself was the most important feature and it far exceeded my expectation.

Reviews.Title: bad product
Reviews.Author: Rachel Ho
Reviews.Content: the button of the image has some problem!! the image quality is not very good. I thought the worst part is the button part. The button seem to break easily because they are not very sensitive. I need to press very hard! The image will turn more yellowish even though the light is enough when i took the picture.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Ima Philly
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip at the last minute. While on the trip I found there were few things about it that annoyed me. It has a lot of nice features but they don't always work when they are suppose to, which was annoying while trying to capture moments on my trip. Overall I think this a is a good camera for an amateur...i.e. me! If I had not waited past the return date, I would have returned the camera and chosen one with more reliable features.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but no data card included!
Reviews.Author: Jay Powers
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, I like the large touch screen, but it came with an empty slot for the micro SD card. I had to order a card and wait another 4 days before I could use any of the functions on the camera, they all use the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Not so amazing....
Reviews.Author: colleen
Reviews.Content: I think it is very slow to take the photo, so I always miss the shot I want. PLus its blury a lot, and I am a photographer. I know my cameras and I love to take photos. But this was a disappointment after I really started using it more. If you are lucky and get the shot nice and clear, it looks great quality. But doesnt happen often. PLus it was sticking when I flipped the screen out to use the deature where you can photograh yourself..it would lock up. I should have stuck with canon since its the best....

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Kerr
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. Since the screen flips up it is really easy to get pictures of yourself with a goup of people.

Reviews.Title: NOT MAC COMPATIBLE!!
Reviews.Author: Gary D. Eaton
Reviews.Content: COULD NOT TRANSFER PHOTOS FROM CAMERA TO MAC BOOK PRO, BOUGHT A CARD READ AND STILL COULD NOT TRANSFER PHOTOS. CALLED SAMSUNG AND WENT THROUGH EVERY FUNCTION ON THE CAMERA TO TRY AND STILL NO LUCK. CAMERA WAS RETURNED 1 WEEK LATER

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: tasha
Reviews.Content: I love it takes great pictures, effects makes it even better, very easy to use, also can upload my photos to my phone without any wires or plugins

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Ian Bruns
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my girlfriend but now I am going to buy one for myself. Probably the coolest looking camera with amazing features. Can't wait to get my hands on my own!! Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I recieved this product just the other day and I was hooked. It is such an easy set up. And also the icons make it super easy to choose the function you plan on using. I am personally using it for a vlogging camera, as the flip viewfinder will make it a lot easier to center myself in the frame. And so far, for that purpose, it has been great!

Reviews.Title: good for self pictures
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: This camera is good to take self pictures, it is slim and ligth, easy to carry.Good to conect by wi fi to share the pictures.Not good to take pictures in low light places,

Reviews.Title: Nice point & shoot with a learning curve!
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my wife. It takes great pictures and has a cool panorama feature. It is WiFi capable, so you can send the picture you just took to someone. The downside to the camera is there was very little in the way of instructions. It came with a quick start info sheet, but it  leaves a lot to be desired as it is not very intuitive. All in all, it is a nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: Interesting
Reviews.Author: rmiller
Reviews.Content: Camera is another hit from Samsung. Performs as advertised. Seller sent wrong color but I discovered a white camera takes same picture a black one does. Great product.

Reviews.Title: horrible service
Reviews.Author: stunter
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera in a hurry for my girlfriends birthday and when i received it in the mail the box was all scratched and discolored like water was spilled on it !!! and also i ordered this camera with the 32 gig memory card package and the camera takes micro sd cards not regular memory cards !!?? very dissapointed with this purchase for how much it cost it was ridiculous!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: Reynaldo P. Castro
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my LEICA point & shoot since I really needed a camera where I can be included in the photo and see what is being shot.  Of course the camera specifications of the Samsung MV900F is not comparable to that of the LEICA, it is good enough for me since I just need to capture photos for recreational use.  The Samsung MV900F is also very pocketable and compact which means that I can take it with me almost all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but...
Reviews.Author: Patricia Cordova
Reviews.Content: This camera does take wonderful pictures however it has already died on me once without warning. It has a lot of picture options and I really enjoy all the functions. I find that when I want to take a picture I have to push multiple buttons before I can take the picture. I think the buttons on the camera should be more sensitive because I have to press multiple times. I bought the camera to take pictures of my kids. They get bored before I can actually take the picture. I dont plan on returning it yet but I might soon... I finally returned it. I found out that the battery has been discontinued and decided to buy a cannon.

Reviews.Title: It's great but too hot
Reviews.Author: Victor Pereyra
Reviews.Content: I like the product, but after some days using it, I starts getting too hot.  When we start taking photos, the camera starts increasing the temperature.  I don't know if it's ok

Reviews.Title: Samsung MV900F Camera
Reviews.Author: LesterT
Reviews.Content: I was looking to broaden our available stash of cameras for an upcoming trip out of the country.  I thought this one would give me all the features I was looking for, and I am not disappointed.  Samsung certainly packed in a load of features, more than most people will ever need.  I also have a Samsung phone, and found that by downloading the MobileLink app from Google Play, I can instantaneously transfer pictures from the camera to my phone.  I also have the MV900F tied to my home network, so I can e-mail photos from the camera to my Google e-mail account.  The e-mail option isn't as quick as MobileLink, but it works seamlessly.  All-in-all, I'm really enjoying the camera.

Reviews.Title: manual
Reviews.Author: harts
Reviews.Content: dosen't come with a user manual, worked all day yesterday with samsung support and still could not get the manual to download from the samsung site onto my macbook pro, finally ended up buying a manual in print off of the samsung site $20  will let you know more about the camera just as soon as i get the user manual

Reviews.Title: Would have been higher
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: My daughter loved the camera I bought for her birthday but we never saw the pictures. She went to Europe and lost it. It looked nice and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: You're going to laugh when you see the Quick Start Guide.
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Clark "richardcclark"
Reviews.Content: Good grief Samsung, how could you guys be so out of touch?Pros: Great image quality (like just about any other camera made these days)Cons: TINY quick start guide made with TEENY TINY print that you can hardly even read.  Proprietary cable - no you can't use your USB cable so you better remember to bring along their cable on your vacation or you're screwed  Bizarre flip display - this accomplishes nothing - when would you ever want to reverse the display?  Think clearly about whether you really care about having wireless in your camera - is it that hard to download your pictures the old fashioned way?  Menus from HELL.  Get ready to loose vacation time while you try and figure out dozens of stupid features that are pointless.  But the REAL KILLER HERE: This camera does not warn you when you have forgotten to put the memory card back in :-(
